2024 live updates: Taylor Swift wins, Katy Perry honored, Megan Thee Stallion hosts and more","articleBody":"The 40th MTV Video Music Awards were chock-full of performances and peppered with memories of the award show’s storied four-decade history.  Taylor Swift took home the biggest award of the night — video of the year — in addition to six others, tying her with Beyoncé for the most VMA wins ever. After tonight, Swift and Beyoncé have 30 Moon People each to their names.  Chappell Roan took home the first major award of her career for best new artist, beating out Gracie Abrams and Tyla after a show-stopping summer on the festival circuit.  Iconic moments from VMAs past also got their place to shine. Notably, host Megan Thee Stallion took the stage with a live snake roped around her body as an homage to Britney Spears’ 2001 “I’m a Slave 4 U” performance. A supercut of such moments also featured Miley Cyrus twerking onstage with Robin Thicke in 2013 and Madonna’s 1984 “Like A Virgin” performance, among many others.  Tonight’s show ushered in a new era of iconic moments, as well, from Sabrina Carpenter’s kissing an alien during a mashup of her newest singles to Benson Boone’s flips off his piano and Roan’s performance in front of a burning castle. After tonight, Swift and Beyoncé have 30 Moon People each to their names. \n\nChappell Roan took home the first major award of her career for best new artist, beating out Gracie Abrams and Tyla after a show-stopping summer on the festival circuit. \n\nIconic moments from VMAs past also got their place to shine. Notably, host Megan Thee Stallion took the stage with a live snake roped around her body as an homage to Britney Spears’ 2001 “I’m a Slave 4 U” performance. A supercut of such moments also featured Miley Cyrus twerking onstage with Robin Thicke in 2013 and Madonna’s 1984 “Like A Virgin” performance, among many others. \n\nTonight’s show ushered in a new era of iconic moments, as well, from Sabrina Carpenter’s kissing an alien during a mashup of her newest singles to Benson Boone’s flips off his piano and Roan’s performance in front of a burning castle.  Everything to know about the 2024 VMAs: Megan Thee Stallion hosted the MTV Video Music Awards show at the UBS Arena in Elmont, New York. Taylor Swift came into the show with 12 nominations, the most of any artist. Post Malone followed with nine nominations, while Ariana Grande, Eminem and Sabrina Carpenter each had six.  Katy Perry received MTV’s Video Vanguard Award and performed a career-spanning medley live. Other performers this year included Carpenter, Camila Cabello, Chappell Roan, GloRilla and Rauw Alejandro. The VMAs have a history of memorable and provocative red carpet looks. more</h1><div class="styles_articleDek__Icz5H styles_withImage__SSIip styles_isLiveBreakingNews___YFYJ" data-testid="article-dek">Taylor Swift, Tyla, Meghan Thee Stallion and Katy Perry all took home class="article-hero__media-container layout-grid-item grid-col-7_5-l grid-col-6-xl grid-col-push-2-xl"><div class="article-hero__video"></div></div></div></section><div class="article-body class="relative z-1" dateTime="2024-09-12T03:29:43.388Z" data-testid="timestamp__datePublished" content="2024-09-12T03:29:43.388Z">Updated<!-- --> <!-- -->Sept. 12, 2024, 3:29 AM UTC</time></div><div class="article-inline-byline" data-activity-map="inline-byline-article-top">By <span class="byline-name" data-testid="byline-name">NBC News</span></div></section><div class="article-body__content"><div class="summary-box"><div class="summary-box__content"><h2 class="summary-box__headline">Everything to know about the 2024 VMAs:</h2><ul class="summary-box__items"><li>Megan Thee Stallion hosted the MTV Video Music Awards show at the UBS Arena in Elmont, New York.</li><li>Taylor Swift came into the show with 12 nominations, the most of any artist. Post Malone followed with nine nominations, while Ariana Grande, Eminem and Sabrina Carpenter each had six. </li><li><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/katy-perry-new-single-womans-world-mixed-response-rcna161162" target="_blank">Katy Perry</a> received <a href="https://youtu.be/lF2iY3WlUwY?si=epZs-jhbLekUJPM7" target="_blank">MTV’s Video Vanguard Award</a> and performed a career-spanning medley live. Other performers this year included <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/sabrina-carpenters-espresso-song-of-summer-rcna153851" target="_blank">Carpenter</a>, Camila Cabello, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/chappell-roan-sabrina-carpenter-charli-xcx-tinashe-redefining-pop-star-rcna159854" target="_blank">Chappell Roan</a>, GloRilla and Rauw Alejandro.</li><li>The VMAs have a history of memorable and provocative red carpet looks. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/music/mtv-vmas-red-carpet-2024-rcna170736" target="_blank">See this year&#x27;s stand-out outfits.</a></li></ul></div></div><p class="">The 40th MTV Video Music Awards were chock-full of performances and peppered with memories of the award show’s storied four-decade history. </p><p class="">Taylor Swift took home the biggest award of the night — video of the year — in addition to six others, tying her with Beyoncé for the most VMA wins ever. After tonight, Swift and Beyoncé have 30 Moon People each to their names. </p><p class="">Chappell Roan took home the first major award of her career for best new artist, beating out Gracie Abrams and Tyla after a show-stopping summer on the festival circuit. </p><p class="">Iconic moments from VMAs past also got their place to shine. Notably, host Megan Thee Stallion took the stage with a live snake roped around her body as an homage to Britney Spears’ 2001 “I’m a Slave 4 U” performance. A supercut of such moments also featured Miley Cyrus twerking onstage with Robin Thicke in 2013 and Madonna’s 1984 “Like A Virgin” performance, among many others. </p><p class="endmark">Tonight’s show ushered in a new era of iconic moments, as well, from Sabrina Carpenter’s kissing an alien during a mashup of her newest singles to Benson Boone’s flips off his piano and Roan’s performance in front of a burning castle. </p><br class=""/></div><div class="article-body__content"><div class="LiveBlog relative liveBlogCards" id="liveBlogCards" data-testid="live-blog-posts"><div data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/rebecca-cohen-ncpn1307773">Rebecca Cohen</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Beyoncé was nominated for three awards tonight — song of the year, best trending video and most iconic performance — but ultimately did not win any. </p><p class="">The lackluster VMAs showing follows her <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/beyonce-snub-country-music-award-nominations-rcna170205" target="_blank">being shut out of the Country Music Award nominations</a> that were announced on Monday after coming out with her first country album, "Cowboy Carter." </p><p class="">Beyoncé still holds the record for most VMAs with 30 statues, although she's now tied with Taylor Swift, who won seven awards tonight.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/daysia-tolentino-ncpn1300077"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">“Directing this video and putting it together and writing it was the most wonderful experience," she said of making the "Fortnight" video with Post Malone. "And that is because of all the people that I got to make it with.”</p><p class="">She also took a moment to thank boyfriend Travis Kelce for cheering her on between takes. </p><p class="">Swift won the award in 2023 for “Anti-Hero” and in 2022 for “All Too Well (10 minute version) (Taylor’s Version).”</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div width="30"/></button></div></div><h2 class="styles_chartCardHeadline__aiJF0" data-testid="chat-card-headline">LL Cool J take some of us back</h2><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2020_03/3184111/richie-duchon-circle-byline-template.jpg 2x, src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2020_03/3184111/richie-duchon-circle-byline-template.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/richie-duchon-ncpn191641">Richie Duchon</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">This LL Cool J performance feels like a time machine to the early 90s. Busta Rhymes tee'd up LL Cool J and Public Enemy to insert some classic hip hop into the VMAs. </p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 1000px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-MTV-VMAs-LL-Cool-J--ac-1130p-0e0c38.jpg 2x, width="30"/></button></div></div><h2 class="styles_chartCardHeadline__aiJF0" data-testid="chat-card-headline">Chappell Roan dedicates first VMA to her LGBTQ fans</h2><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489">Kaetlyn Liddy</a></span><span class="styles_chatCardByline--shortbio__PRRNd">Kaetlyn Liddy is a newsroom coordinator for NBC News Digital.</span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">The <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/chappell-roan-sabrina-carpenter-charli-xcx-tinashe-redefining-pop-star-rcna159854" target="_blank">rise of a Midwest Princess</a> continues.</p><p class="">After making her VMAs debut with a performance of her breakout hit, "Good Luck, Babe!", Chappell Roan took home her first Moon Person for best new artist.</p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 1000px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-MTV-VMAs-Chappelle-Roan-award--ac-1118p-a66dce.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-MTV-VMAs-Chappelle-Roan-award--ac-1118p-a66dce.jpg 1x"/><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-MTV-VMAs-Chappelle-Roan-award--ac-1118p-a66dce.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-MTV-VMAs-Chappelle-Roan-award--ac-1118p-a66dce.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-MTV-VMAs-Chappelle-Roan-award--ac-1118p-a66dce.jpg" alt="Image: 2024 MTV Video Music Awards - Show chappelle roan award VMAs" height="1667" width="2500"/></picture><figcaption class="caption styles_caption__Pe5JC" data-testid="caption"><span class="caption__container" data-testid="caption__container">Chappell Roan accepts the Best New Artist award on stage during the 2024 MTV Video Music Awards at UBS Arena, in Elmont, N.Y., on Wednesday.</span><span class="caption__source" data-testid="caption__source">Manny Carabel / Getty Images for MTV</span></figcaption></figure><p class="">"I dedicate this to all the drag artists who inspire me and I dedicate this to queer and trans people who fuel pop," Roan said in her speech, reading from her diary. On her "Midwest Princess" tour, Roan invited local drag artists to open her shows. She has also spoken extensively about the role <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/chappell-roan-sabrina-carpenter-charli-xcx-tinashe-redefining-pop-star-rcna159854" target="_blank">drag plays in her own performances. </a></p><p class="">She added, "For all the queer kids in the Midwest watching right now, I see you, I understand you, because I’m one of you."</p><p class="">With the best new artist win, she joined the lofty company of artists like Billie Eilish, Olivia Rodrigo and Cardi B, who have all won the award.</p><div Madani</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Before the show began, Rauw Alejandro told interviewers he wanted to honor his Puerto Rican culture on stage tonight. He added that he also wanted to throw in nods to New York, where many Puerto Ricans have created tight-knit communities. </p><p class="">Alejandro delivered by honoring his Nuyorican roots on a set that emulated the city's apartment rooftops. He was joined by dancers and musicians who helped bring a slice of the island's musical heritage to the stage. </p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x"><picture data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">The South African singer Tyla won for her hit song "Water," which also spawned a viral trend on TikTok. </p><p class="">"African music can be pop music too," she said. "This is just so special but also bittersweet because I know there's a tendency to group all African artists under afrobeats."</p><p class="">The artist is also nominated for best new artist.</p><p class="">"African music is so diverse, it's more than just Afrobeats," she said as she accepted her award.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="ad data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">After a loving intro from drag queen Sasha Colby, Chappell Roan took the VMAs stage in full armor in front of a burning castle as she sang "Good Luck, Babe!" her hit summer single that has helped propel her to stardom. </p><p class="">Roan's rise to fame began with an opening act during Olivia Rodrigo's "Guts" tour in the Spring, which then paved the way for a sold-out festival circuit, all leading her to tonight's stage, where she is nominated for her first major awards including best new artist. </p><p class="">Roan credits Colby with a slogan she's used to reference herself — "your favorite artist's favorite artist." After shouting that on stage this summer, Roan said she got the quote from Colby, who coined "your favorite drag queen's favorite drag queen." </p><p class="">Colby introduced Roan tonight as "your favorite drag queen’s favorite artist."</p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 1000px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Chappell-Roan-VMAs-jg-b9b9eb.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Chappell-Roan-VMAs-jg-b9b9eb.jpg 1x"/><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Chappell-Roan-VMAs-jg-b9b9eb.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Chappell-Roan-VMAs-jg-b9b9eb.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Chappell-Roan-VMAs-jg-b9b9eb.jpg" alt="Chappell Roan performs her single &quot;Good Luck Babe.&quot;" height="1667" width="2500"/></picture><figcaption class="caption styles_caption__Pe5JC" data-testid="caption"><span class="caption__container" data-testid="caption__container">Chappell pre-show livestream, no other statues have been given out since Taylor Swift and Post Malone accepted the best collaboration award. </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ width="30"/></button></div></div><h2 class="styles_chartCardHeadline__aiJF0" data-testid="chat-card-headline">Katy Perry performs her most nostalgic hits ahead of accepting Vanguard Award</h2><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851">Angela Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Katy Perry gave a high-energy performance ahead of her acceptance of the Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award.</p><p class="">She was introduced by her fiancé Orlando Bloom, who gave a heartfelt tribute to the longtime pop star, noting that “the remarkable world she creates has brought a sense of joy and laughter, inspiring generations of people from all over the world.”</p><p class="">She took the stage in a cloud of colored smoke, held up by cables as she sang a mashup of “Dark Horse” and “E.T.” in mid-air. The singer then brought Doechii onstage for a snippet of their upcoming release “I’M HIS, HE’S MINE.”</p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x styles_portrait__NRWbO"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 1000px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Katy-VMAs-jg-38729f.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Katy-VMAs-jg-38729f.jpg 1x"/><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Katy-VMAs-jg-38729f.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Katy-VMAs-jg-38729f.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-Katy-VMAs-jg-38729f.jpg" alt="Katy Perry performed a medley of hits including &quot;I Kissed a Girl&quot; and &quot;Teenage Dream.&quot;" height="3750" width="2500"/></picture><figcaption class="caption styles_caption__Pe5JC" data-testid="caption"><span class="caption__container" data-testid="caption__container">Katy Perry performed a medley of hits including &quot;I Kissed a Girl&quot; and &quot;Teenage Dream.&quot;</span><span class="caption__source" data-testid="caption__source">Mike Coppola / Getty Images</span></figcaption></figure><p class="">Perry continued the show with a nostalgic string of her fan-favorites — “California Gurls,” “Teenage Dream,” “I Kissed a Girl” and “Firework" — before ending with her latest release "LIFETIMES" and sharing a post-performance kiss with Bloom.</p><p class="">"Thank you. I did that all on my first day of my period, too, can you believe it?" she said breathlessly as she accepted her Moon Person.</p><p class="">"I just want to say with my whole heart: Do whatever it takes to stay true to yourself and true to your art," she added in her speech. "Turn off social media, safeguard your mental health, pause, touch grass." </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="ad mb8 ad--text-alignment Madani</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Always one to keep people on their toes, Taylor Swift has made an unexpected outfit change. </p><p class="">While Swift arrived in a punk plaid ensemble, she appears to now be seated in a sparkling green gown. The singer was seen on an online stream in a beaded outfit that had a spaceship display, a likely nod to her performance of "Down Bad" during the "The Eras Tour," which features visuals of a UFO. data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x styles_noCaption__KOOim"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 1000px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-07/240718-rise-of-the-mid-popstar-jg-6a8d2a.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-07/240718-rise-of-the-mid-popstar-jg-6a8d2a.jpg 1x"/><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-07/240718-rise-of-the-mid-popstar-jg-6a8d2a.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-07/240718-rise-of-the-mid-popstar-jg-6a8d2a.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-07/240718-rise-of-the-mid-popstar-jg-6a8d2a.jpg" alt="Photo Illustration: (L-R)Tinashe, Charli xcx, Chappell Roan, Sabrina Carpenter" height="3312" width="5040"/></picture><figcaption class="caption styles_caption__Pe5JC" data-testid="caption"><span class="caption__source" data-testid="caption__source">Justine Goode / NBC News; Getty Images</span></figcaption></figure><p class="">Chappell Roan is no longer just “your favorite artist’s favorite artist.”</p><p class="">Roan, who is known for the queer themes in her music and her drag-inspired aesthetic, is among the recent crop of artists who have hit unforeseen career highs in recent months, despite being considered part of pop music’s “middle class.” </p><p class="">This designation has typically been associated with artists who have cultivated devout <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2023/08/14/arts/music/pop-musics-middle-class.html" target="_blank">online fan bases</a>, but who are not necessarily household names.</p><p class="">A-list pop stardom has become increasingly difficult to achieve. But some music industry experts say the recent rise of Roan and others — including Sabrina Carpenter, Tinashe and Charli XCX — is a testament to their authenticity and ability to foster such strong fandoms.</p><p class=""><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/chappell-roan-sabrina-carpenter-charli-xcx-tinashe-redefining-pop-star-rcna159854" target="_blank"><strong><em>Read the full story here.</em></strong></a></p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="ad mb8 ad--text-alignment ad-container mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851">Angela Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Taylor Swift just took home her second Moon Person of the night with a win for best collaboration for “Fortnight” featuring Post Malone. She opened her acceptance speech with an acknowledgement of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks given the event's location in New York. </p><p class="">Speaking about her music video, Swift described her collaborator Post Malone as “everyone in music’s favorite person to collaborate with.”</p><p class="">“And it is because you are so ridiculously talented, you are so versatile and you’re the most down to earth person,” Swift said. “Honestly, so unfailingly polite, it has taken me forever to get him to stop calling me ‘ma’am.’”</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489">Kaetlyn Liddy</a></span><span data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">After being <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/sports/olympics/jordan-chiles-stripped-bronze-gymnastics-biggest-controversy-2000-sydn-rcna166447" target="_blank">stripped of her Olympic bronze medal </a>shortly after leaving Paris, Flavor Flav followed through on his <a href="https://x.com/FlavorFlav/status/1822764729041125787" target="_blank">promise</a> to award Jordan Chiles a custom-made replacement.</p><p class="">"I gotcha something that they can't take away from you," Flavor Flav told the two-time Olympian on the VMAs stage. He bestowed her with a bronze clock necklace and tied it on her neck himself.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/daysia-tolentino-ncpn1300077"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/daysia-tolentino-ncpn1300077">Daysia Tolentino</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">The host opened the show with a message to everyone watching.</p><p class="">“Shout out to my hotties, and my haties ‘cause I know y’all watching too,” she said.</p><p class="">She donned a Team USA-inspired leotard while greeting viewers. She then passed the mic to Jordan Chiles and Flavor Flav. </p><p class="">Flav gave Chiles a bronze clock and promised to gift her the prize money she lost after her bronze medal was stripped from her after last month's Paris Olympic Games. </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489">Kaetlyn Liddy</a></span><span class="styles_chatCardByline--shortbio__PRRNd">Kaetlyn Liddy is a newsroom coordinator for NBC News Digital.</span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">The VMA for best rock video went to Lenny Kravitz for “Human” from his 2024 album, “Blue Electric Light.”</p><p class="">He dedicated the award to his late mother, who died in 1995. </p><p class="">"31 years ago, my mother was with me," he said after his win. "The last time she was with me at an award show was at the VMAs and so I dedicate this to her.”</p><p class="">Kravitz will perform at tonight's ceremony for the first time since 1998.</p><div 17.2777L21.1262 13.5235Z" fill="#069DE0"></path></svg></a></span></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/doha-madani-ncpn915866">Doha Madani</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">The highly anticipated arrival of Taylor Swift is finally here as the singer poses for the cameras ahead of tonight's show. She won a VMA for song of summer before even setting foot on the carpet. </p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x styles_portrait__NRWbO"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 1000px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-vmas-red-carpet-taylor-swift-01-cs-368267.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-vmas-red-carpet-taylor-swift-01-cs-368267.jpg 1x"/><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240911-vmas-red-carpet-taylor-swift-01-cs-368267.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-vmas-red-carpet-taylor-swift-01-cs-368267.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240911-vmas-red-carpet-taylor-swift-01-cs-368267.jpg" alt="Image: Taylor Swift" height="2500" width="1667"/></picture><figcaption class="caption styles_caption__Pe5JC" data-testid="caption"><span class="caption__container" data-testid="caption__container">Taylor Swift arrives at the MTV Video Music Awards on Wednesday.</span><span class="caption__source" data-testid="caption__source">Noam Galai / Getty Images</span></figcaption></figure><p class="">Swift is known for using her award show outfits as a way to clue in fans about her upcoming projects. Last year, Swift's black and white dress at the Grammys hinted at her announcement of the album "The Tortured Poets Department" later during the show. That came after she announced her album "Midnights" at the 2022 VMAs, wearing a silver-draped dress that hinted at a new "Bejewled" era for the singer. </p><p class="">So with fans eager for her to drop "reputation (Taylor's Version)," is her outfit signaling any easter eggs for news to come? </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/rebecca-cohen-ncpn1307773">Rebecca Cohen</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Taylor Swift has officially won her first award of the night. </p><p class="">Her single "Fortnight" from "The Tortured Poets Department" won song of the summer, which was announced on the VMAs red carpet before the awards show even kicked off. </p><p class="">If she takes home at least six more of the 12 awards she's nominated for tonight, she will match Beyoncé's record for most VMA wins. </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851">Angela Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Megan Thee Stallion was caught off guard by the news of her own win as pre-show host Kevan Kenney abruptly handed her a Moon Person. The rapper, who is also hosting the VMAs this year, clinched the best trending video award for “Mamushi” featuring Yuki Chiba.</p><p class="">“Me and Yuki recorded that song in Japan in like, a small apartment studio, and we were just messing around,” Megan said, adding that she was "shocked" by fans' embrace of the song. </p><p class="">The singer is up for six more categories tonight.</p><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/isabela-espadas-barros-leal-ncpn1161816">Isabela Espadas Barros Leal</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">This year’s show had originally been scheduled for Sept. 10 but was moved to Sept. 11 because the broadcast would clash with <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/trump-harris-presidential-debate-live-updates-rcna169722#rcrd54561" target="_blank">Tuesday’s presidential debate. </a></p><p class="">The show’s producers <a href="https://www.paramountpressexpress.com/mtv/shows/2024-vmas/releases/?view=110202-mtv-and-televisaunivision-expand-partnership-for-2024-vmas-live-simulcast-on-wednesday-september-11th-at-8pm-etpt" target="_blank">plan to recognize the 9/11 attacks</a> by donating proceeds from the show to 9/11 Day, a nonprofit that organizes community service programs on the anniversary of the attacks, and Tuesday’s Children, which helps support impacted families. </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content fill="#069DE0"></path></svg></a></span></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/doha-madani-ncpn915866">Doha Madani</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Pop sensation Taylor Swift is the most nominated artist of the night, with the potential to make history by breaking fellow nominee Beyoncé's record. </p><p class="">Swift is up for a total of 12 awards, including video of the year, artist of the year and song of the year. Currently, Swift has a total of 23 VMAs throughout her career and is seven awards shy of matching Beyoncé's record of 30. </p><p class="">But Beyoncé is also nominated for several VMAs tonight following the success of her country album "Cowboy Carter" — which was notably <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/beyonce-cma-snub-cowboy-carter-experts-rcna170480" target="_blank">snubbed from the Country Music Association Awards</a> earlier this week. The album's hit song, "Texas Hold 'Em," is up against Swift's "Fortnight" for song of the year. </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" id="rcrd55015" data-testid="chat-card-container"><div class="styles_time-stamp-social-share-container__zWQeJ"><div mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851">Angela Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">British actress and singer Naomi Scott, who plays pop star Skye Riley in the upcoming film “Smile 2,” said her character drew inspiration from some of the pop stars here tonight.</p><p class="">As for the movie itself, slated to release in theaters Oct. 18, the first-time VMA attendee teased it as being “kind of like the first movie, but on steroids and a lot of party drugs.</p><p class="">“It’s very intense, but it’s so fun and so unhinged and also kind of funny,” Scott said. “My director brought me in to watch some of the edit, and I remember just being like, I wish I was here with my best friend, because we would just be grabbing each other laughing and screaming.”</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="ad mb8 ad--text-alignment ad-container boxinlineAd dn-print" width="30"/></button></div></div><h2 class="styles_chartCardHeadline__aiJF0" data-testid="chat-card-headline">&#x27;Dreams don’t have deadlines:&#x27; LL Cool J on his first album in a decade</h2><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489">Kaetlyn Liddy</a></span><span class="styles_chatCardByline--shortbio__PRRNd">Kaetlyn Liddy is a newsroom coordinator for NBC News Digital.</span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">After a 10-year break from releasing music, LL Cool J dropped his 14th studio album, "The Force," on Friday.</p><p class="">"I wanted to show the people that I came up with that your dreams don't have deadlines," he said on the MTV pre-show. "You could continue to do this thing at a high level. You don't have to be successful at one age and then all of a sudden taper off and wallow around in mediocrity."</p><p class="">He is set to perform in tonight’s ceremony, but the legendary artist's relationship with the VMAs started 27 years ago. LL Cool J became the first rap artist to win the Video Vanguard Award in 1997, which he noted as his favorite VMAs moment.</p><p class="">"I am a kid raised on hip hop ... So that was an unbelievable moment," he said of the honor.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" id="rcrd55003" data-testid="chat-card-container"><div class="styles_time-stamp-social-share-container__zWQeJ"><div class="styles_chatCardTimestamp__Lhru2 styles_eventEnded__gIoTG"><div width="30"/></button></div></div><h2 class="styles_chartCardHeadline__aiJF0" data-testid="chat-card-headline">Jordan Chiles makes VMAs debut after bronze medal debacle</h2><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489">Kaetlyn Liddy</a></span><span class="styles_chatCardByline--shortbio__PRRNd">Kaetlyn Liddy is a newsroom coordinator for NBC News Digital.</span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Two-time Olympic champion <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/sports/olympics/jordan-chiles-olympic-gymnast-rcna165797" target="_blank">Jordan Chiles</a> made her first public appearances on Wednesday since she was <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/sports/olympics/jordan-chiles-stripped-bronze-gymnastics-biggest-controversy-2000-sydn-rcna166447" target="_blank">stripped of her bronze medal</a> from the Paris Olympic Games.</p><p class="">"This is a dream come true to be able to come to the VMAs," Chiles said. "Meeting people, especially celebrities out here." Despite the big names in the room, Chiles said her Olympic resume has prepared her for this moment. </p><p class="">Competing is "harder than doing an interview," she joked.</p><p class="">Hours before the VMAs ceremony, Chiles spoke at the Forbes Power Women’s Summit in New York City, where she said the controversy was more about <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jordan-chiles-looking-peace-justice-bronze-medal-dispute-rcna170689" target="_blank">"peace" and "justice" </a>for her than the medal itself.</p><p class="">"The biggest thing that was taken from me was the recognition of who I was, not just my sport, but the person I am ... the star is never going to get dimmed." she said.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" id="rcrd55032" data-testid="chat-card-container"><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851">Angela Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Chappell, who is nominated for best new artist alongside three other categories, said it would be “awesome” if she won — noting that she’s “never won anything.” If she does cinch the category, she said, she wants to give a shoutout to her ex: “You got me here.”</p><p class="">Chappell said she’s a bit nervous about performing in front of her peers tonight, many of whom she said she looks up to. The pop star teased in a red-carpet interview with MTV that her performance will include “a lot of technical things going on that I’ve never had happen.”</p><p class="">She also shared a few details about the medieval look she donned on the carpet.</p><p class="">“That robe that I had on ... was 300 years old. And then the rug that was rolled out is 600 years old," she said.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J class="">The winner for best alternative is Benson Boone for his song “Beautiful Things,” awarded during the pre-show  livestream on YouTube. </p><p class="">Boone thanked the fans for all their support and their votes as he accepted the Moon Man statue  in an interview on the carpet. </p><p class="">“You know what? data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/rebecca-cohen-ncpn1307773">Rebecca Cohen</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Halsey put the red in red carpet tonight (although the VMAs carpet is technically black), with long, bright red locks and a gown to match. </p><p class="">She also teased her later performance of a new song called "Ego," which officially dropped on Friday as the fourth single in the lead up to her highly-anticipated album, "The Great Impersonator." </p><p class="">In June, the singer revealed she <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/halsey-health-issues-social-media-song-release-end-rcna155483" target="_blank">has been battling chronic illnesses</a> in a social media post tied to the release of "The End," another song on her upcoming album. In the post, Halsey did not confirm any diagnoses. </p><p class="">"long story short, i'm Lucky to be alive. short story long, i wrote an album," Halsey wrote in the post.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" id="rcrd54580" data-testid="chat-card-container"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2022_46/3581059/kaetlyn-liddy-byline-jm.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/kaetlyn-liddy-ncpn1299489">Kaetlyn Liddy</a></span><span class="styles_chatCardByline--shortbio__PRRNd">Kaetlyn Liddy is a newsroom coordinator for NBC News Digital.</span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">If the Grammys are the music industry's biggest night, the VMAs may be the most entertaining. </p><p class="">Since the first VMAs were held in New York City's Radio City Music Hall in 1984, an astounding number of prolific moments in pop culture history have taken place with the iconic "moon person" statue standing nearby.</p><p class="">From Kanye West interrupting Taylor Swift’s acceptance speech at the 2009 ceremony to Madonna, Britney Spears and Christina Aguilera shocking early 2000's America by kissing onstage, the VMAs have a knack for crystalizing cultural moments. Many of these moments will likely be revisited tonight in the <a href="https://digital.abcaudio.com/news/mtv-vmas-announce-most-iconic-performance-nods-other-social-categories" target="_blank">new most iconic performance category.</a></p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" Madani</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Jason and Travis Kelce are excited for everyone nominated for a moon man tonight, but they're especially hyped for Taylor Swift. </p><p class="">The brothers plugged the award show as one of the advertisements in this morning's episode of their podcast "New Heights." Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce proudly pointed out that his girlfriend was up for multiple VMA awards. </p><p class="">"Let's go, Tay! Come on, Tay!" Jason Kelce cheered. </p><p class="">"Stay on top! Here we go," Travis Kelce said while clapping. "Wishing everybody the best though." </p><p class="">"Unless you're up against Tay, then I hope you lose," his brother joked. </p><section class="embed-widget embedWidget embed-widget--medium" She is also expected to perform tonight.</p><p class="">In an interview with MTV on the carpet, she shared why her music video for the song was so special.</p><p class="">"I had a chance to shoot in my home country, in Bangkok, and I think it's really cool," she said.</p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x styles_portrait__NRWbO"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851">Angela Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">This year marks the 40th anniversary of MTV's Video Music Awards. </p><p class="">Over the course of its history, the VMAs have remained a cornerstone of the music awards landscape despite drastic changes in the music, video and broadcast landscapes. </p><p class="">The show has kept its relevance in part by delivering moments of controversy that ultimately shaped pop culture history. It's also managed to integrate  digital platforms into its programming, including by adding categories that honor social media success and even allowing viewers to vote for their favorite artists via Instagram stories.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" id="rcrd54996" class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" width="30"/></button></div></div><h2 class="styles_chartCardHeadline__aiJF0" data-testid="chat-card-headline">The rapid rise of Chappell Roan</h2><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_40/3624855/angelayang.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/angela-yang-ncpn1287851">Angela Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Once a niche pop singer from Missouri trying to make it in Los Angeles, Chappell Roan has <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/chappell-roan-sabrina-carpenter-charli-xcx-tinashe-redefining-pop-star-rcna159854" target="_blank">skyrocketed to mainstream fame</a> over the past year. Known for the queer themes in her music as well as her drag-inspired aesthetic, Roan’s high-energy music — paired with her deeply emotional lyricism — has earned her a cult following online.</p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 1000px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240905-Chappell-Roan-al-1420-72aa2d.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-560w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240905-Chappell-Roan-al-1420-72aa2d.jpg 1x"/><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/rockcms/2024-09/240905-Chappell-Roan-al-1420-72aa2d.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240905-Chappell-Roan-al-1420-72aa2d.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_fit-760w,f_auto,q_auto:best/rockcms/2024-09/240905-Chappell-Roan-al-1420-72aa2d.jpg" alt="Chappell Roan" height="1667" width="2500"/></picture><figcaption class="caption styles_caption__Pe5JC" data-testid="caption"><span class="caption__container" data-testid="caption__container">Chappell Roan in Palm Springs, Calif., on Feb. 23.</span><span class="caption__source" data-testid="caption__source">Christopher Polk / Billboard via Getty Images file </span></figcaption></figure><p class="">Her debut album “The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess,” released last September, became a sleeper hit that further cemented her status this summer as a rising pop icon. The album charted in the top five on the U.S. Billboard 200 earlier this year, after Roan’s stint as Olivia Rodrigo’s opening act and the release of her hit followup single, “Good Luck, Babe!”</p><p class="">The artist has been open in speaking about the impact of sudden fame on her mental health, recently <a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/chappell-roan-good-luck-babe-fame-fans-1235094314/" target="_blank">telling Rolling Stone</a> that "it's been a really hard adjustment." </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="ad mb8 ad--text-alignment ad-container boxinlineAd dn-print" data-testid="ad__container"><div data-mps="true" Yang</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Chappell Roan has arrived at the VMAs — holding a sword. The rising pop star is up for four categories this year, including best new artist and song of summer. She's also one of the night's most anticipated performers. </p><figure class="styles_inlineImage__yAWZ0 styles_medium__OMa6x styles_portrait__NRWbO"><picture class="styles_image__1qciH" width="30"/></button></div></div><h2 class="styles_chartCardHeadline__aiJF0" data-testid="chat-card-headline">Katy Perry to receive the Video Vanguard Award</h2><div class="styles_authors-container__IX4r8 mb3"><div class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/daysia-tolentino-ncpn1300077"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/daysia-tolentino-ncpn1300077">Daysia Tolentino</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">The pop star and <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/katy-perry-says-leaving-american-idol-7-seasons-see-world-bring-new-mu-rcna138582" target="_blank">recently departed American Idol judge</a> dominated the 2010s with hits like “Teenage Dream,” “California Gurls” and “Roar,” delivering some classic, candy-colored music videos along the way. </p><p class="">Now, ahead of her upcoming album “143,” she is being honored with the Video Vanguard Award, which celebrates artists who have made major contributions to music videos and popular culture. </p><p class="">As is tradition with the winners of this award, Perry will perform a medley of her biggest hits.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J class="styles_chatCartByline__ivtPj" data-testid="chat-card-byline-container"><div class="styles_chatCardBylineThumbnail__DItS4" data-testid="chat-card-byline-thumbnail"><div class="byline-thumbnail byline-thumbnail--has-image styles_bylineThumbnail__bRfvX" data-testid="byline-thumbnail"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/daysia-tolentino-ncpn1300077"><picture data-testid="picture"><source media="(min-width: 320px)" srcSet="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_avif,q_auto:eco,dpr_2/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg 2x, https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg 1x"/><img loading="lazy" src="https://media-cldnry.s-nbcnews.com/image/upload/t_focal-60x60,f_auto,q_auto:best/newscms/2023_08/3595666/daysia-tolentino-byline-jm-1.jpg" alt="" height="48" width="48"/></picture></a></div></div><div class="styles_inner__ukqsN"><p class="styles_authors__quDSP" data-testid="chat-card-byline"><span class="styles_chatCardByline__GHQTo" data-testid="chatCardByline-name"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--bio__HWAK9"><span class="styles_chatCardByline--name___FmI_"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/author/daysia-tolentino-ncpn1300077">Daysia Tolentino</a></span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="">Eminem is set to open the show with songs from his most recent album, “The Death of Slim Shady (Coup de Grâce).”</p><p class="">Chappell Roan and Sabrina Carpenter, the two rising stars who arguably defined this <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/sabrina-carpenters-espresso-song-of-summer-rcna153851" target="_blank">summer's pop music landscape,</a> will also perform. </p><p class="">Speaking of pop queens, Katy Perry will return to the VMAs for the first time since 2017 to accept the Video Vanguard Award and perform her biggest hits. </p><p class="">Other performers include host Megan Thee Stallion, GloRilla, Anitta, Camila Cabello, Halsey, Karol G, Lenny Kravitz, LE SSERAFIM, LISA, LL Cool J, Rauw Alejandro, Shawn Mendes and Jessie Murph.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ dn"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__nFL_J article-body__content w-100 mh0 fn" id="rcrd54965" data-testid="chat-card-container"><div class="styles_time-stamp-social-share-container__zWQeJ"><div class="styles_chatCardTimestamp__Lhru2 styles_eventEnded__gIoTG"><div TODAY</span></span></span></p></div></div></div><div data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><h3 class="">Video of the year</h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Ariana Grande — “we can’t be friends (wait for your love)”</li><li>Billie Eilish — “LUNCH”</li><li>Doja Cat — “Paint The Town Red”</li><li>Eminem — “Houdini”</li><li>SZA — “Snooze”</li><li>Taylor Swift ft. Post Malone — “Fortnight”</li></ul><h3 class=""><strong>Artist of the year</strong></h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Ariana Grande</li><li>Bad Bunny</li><li>Eminem</li><li>Sabrina Carpenter</li><li>SZA</li><li>Taylor Swift</li></ul><div class="styles_showMoreButtonWrapper__UDXl2"><button class="animated-ghost-button animated-ghost-button--medium styles_showMoreButton__SY7Pd" type="button" data-testid="button-hover-animation">Show more</button></div><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__37qyQ"><h3 class=""><strong>Song of the year</strong></h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Beyoncé — “Texas Hold ‘Em”</li><li>Jack Harlow — “Lovin On Me”</li><li>Kendrick Lamar — “Not Like Us”</li><li>Sabrina Carpenter — “Espresso”</li><li>Taylor Swift ft. Post Malone — “Fortnight”</li><li>Teddy Swims — “Lose Control”</li></ul><h3 class="">Best New Artist</h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Chappell Roan</li><li>Gracie Abrams</li><li>Tyla</li></ul><h3 class=""><strong>MTV Push Performance of the Year</strong></h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Aug. 2023: Kaliii — “Area Codes”</li><li>Sept. 2023: GloRilla — “Lick or Sum”</li><li>Oct. 2023: Benson Boone — “In The Stars”</li><li>Nov. 2023: Coco Jones — “ICU”</li><li>Dec. 2023: Victoria Monét — “On My Mama”</li><li>Jan. 2024: Jessie Murph — “Wild Ones”</li><li>Feb. 2024: Teddy Swims — “Lose Control”</li><li>March 2024: Chappell Roan — “Red Wine Supernova”</li><li>April 2024: Flyana Boss — “yeaaa”</li><li>May 2024: Laufey — “Goddess”</li><li>June 2024: LE SSERAFIM — “EASY”</li><li>July 2024: The Warning — “Automatic Sun”</li></ul><h3 class=""><strong>Best collaboration</strong></h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Drake ft. Sexyy Red & SZA — “Rich Baby Daddy”</li><li>GloRilla, Megan Thee Stallion — “Wanna Be”</li><li>Jessie Murph ft. Jelly Roll — “Wild Ones”</li><li>Jung Kook ft. Latto — “Seven”</li><li>Post Malone ft. Morgan Wallen — “I Had Some Help”</li><li>Taylor Swift ft. Post Malone — “Fortnight”</li></ul><h3 class="">Best pop </h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Camila Cabello</li><li>Dua Lipa</li><li>Olivia Rodrigo</li><li>Sabrina Carpenter</li><li>Tate McRae</li><li>Taylor Swift</li></ul><h3 class="">Best hip-hop </h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Drake ft. Playboi Carti — “FE!N”</li></ul><h3 class="">Best R&B</h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Alicia Keys — “Lifeline”</li><li>Muni Long — “Made For Me”</li><li>SZA — “Snooze”</li><li>Tyla — “Water”</li><li>USHER, Summer Walker, 21 Savage — “Good Good”</li><li>Victoria Monét — “On My Mama”</li></ul><h3 class="">Best alternative </h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Benson Boone — “Beautiful Things”</li><li>Bleachers — “Tiny Moves”</li><li>Hozier — “Too Sweet”</li><li>Imagine Dragons — “Eyes Closed”</li><li>Linkin Park — “Friendly Fire”</li><li>Teddy Swims — “Lose Control (Live)”</li></ul><h3 class="">Best rock</h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Bon Jovi — “Legendary”</li><li>Coldplay — “feelslikeimfallinginlove”</li><li>Green Day — “Dilemma”</li><li>Kings of Leon — “Mustang”</li><li>Lenny Kravitz — “Human”</li><li>U2 — “Atomic City”</li></ul><h3 class="">Best Latin</h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Anitta — “Mil Veces”</li><li>Bad Bunny — “MONACO”</li><li>KAROL G — “MI EX TENÍA RAZÓN”</li><li>Myke Towers — “LALA”</li><li>Peso Pluma & Anitta — “BELLAKEO”</li><li>Rauw Alejandro — “Touching The Sky”</li><li>Shakira & Cardi B — “Puntería”</li></ul><h3 class="">Best afrobeats</h3><ul class="break-above body-ul body-list-el"><li>Ayra Starr ft. On her \"Midwest Princess\" tour, Roan invited local drag artists to open her shows. She has also spoken extensively about the role drag plays in her own performances. ","Taylor Swift took home the biggest award of the night — video of the year — in addition to six others, tying her with Beyoncé for the most VMA wins ever. After tonight, Swift and Beyoncé have 30 Moon People each to their names. ","Chappell Roan took home the first major award of her career for best new artist, beating out Gracie Abrams and Tyla after a show-stopping summer on the festival circuit. ","Iconic moments from VMAs past also got their place to shine. Notably, host Megan Thee Stallion took the stage with a live snake roped around her body as an homage to Britney Spears’ 2001 “I’m a Slave 4 U” performance. A supercut of such moments also featured Miley Cyrus twerking onstage with Robin Thicke in 2013 and Madonna’s 1984 “Like A Virgin” performance, among many others.
